summary: The 2 main contract types that DOD uses to acquire its major weapon systems are: Cost-type contracts—DOD pays allowable contractor costs (e.g., labor) and risks paying more if costs increase Fixed-price-type contracts—DOD pays a fixed price, at which the contractor must deliver the item or service We analyzed 21 weapon acquisition programs and found that the type of contract DOD used didn’t affect how well...
title: Cost-Type Contracts: Procedures Needed for Sharing Information on Contract Choice among Military Departments
